main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects were reported over Elmendorf AFB, Alaska, in 1953.
interesting points: One object was described as a round metallic object, approximately 30-40 feet in diameter, traveling at an estimated speed of 100 mph., Observers reported seeing disc-shaped, white-colored objects traveling at high speeds estimated to be approximately 30,000 feet in altitude., The objects were confirmed visually by qualified observers and radars indicating intelligent control., A red light was reported to be stationary for about five minutes before vanishing., The sighting involved multiple credible witnesses from the Air Force with extensive experience.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects including a round metallic object and a large red light
witness description: members of the 23rd Bomb Sq, 21st Bomb Wg, 10th Air Div (Def) including Major Wilbur L. Morris, Capt Louis R. Raschke, 1st Lt Donald R. Taylor, and others
